summary: This is an internal FBI email chain from January 2020 discussing preparation for an interview with the Assistant Director in Charge (ADIC) about human trafficking cases. The email mentions using high-profile cases like Epstein and NXIVM as examples, and references other recent trafficking investigations.

persons.name: E. (NY) (FBI)
persons.context: Mentioned as someone who should attend a prep meeting with the ADIC regarding human trafficking cases, including Epstein.

persons.name: Hubert Dupigny
persons.context: Referenced as a subject of a sex trafficking conviction in Manhattan federal court, cited as an example case for the ADIC interview.

events.title: ADIC Interview on Human Trafficking
events.description: Planned interview of the FBI Assistant Director in Charge with a radio station, focusing on human trafficking cases.

events.title: Prep Meeting with ADIC
events.description: Informal meeting scheduled to prepare the ADIC for his interview on human trafficking, including discussion of high-profile cases like Epstein.

keyFacts: The FBI was preparing a senior official (ADIC) for a media interview about human trafficking in January 2020.
The Epstein case was explicitly cited as a 'high profile case' to be discussed in the context of human trafficking.
The NXIVM case was also mentioned alongside Epstein as another high-profile example.
The email references other recent sex trafficking investigations, including the conviction of Hubert Dupigny and arrests in the Bronx and Brooklyn.
